basic_info.location: Queens, New York (same apartment as Carlos)

physical_description.build: soft, warm - the kind of presence that makes you feel safe
distinguishing_features: warm brown eyes that see everything
salt-and-pepper hair kept in practical bun during work, down on Sundays
hands always busy - cooking, cleaning, caring
smile lines deep around eyes and mouth - laughs easily despite hardship

health_status.overall: remarkably healthy despite 25 years of physical caregiving work
health_status.fatigue: chronic exhaustion she never mentions - works 50-hour weeks at 59
health_status.minor_issues: knee pain, carpal tunnel from lifting patients, waves it off

core_traits: emotional intelligence - reads her family like sheet music, knows what everyone needs before they say it
fierce optimism - 'we've survived worse' is her mantra
manages everyone's feelings - emotional load-bearer for the whole family
talks where Carlos is silent - fills space with warmth and questions
worries out loud - unlike Carlos, she processes by talking through fears
unofficial family therapist - Steve, Elena, even Jordan come to her first

communication_style.with_steve: asks real questions, doesn't accept deflection - 'mijo, tell me the truth, how bad is it?'
communication_style.with_carlos: translates his silences for the kids, protects his pride while managing reality
communication_style.with_elena: intellectual respect - doesn't fully understand PhD work but asks detailed questions
communication_style.with_jordan: treats them like third child - 'have you eaten? Steve, did you feed your partner?'

emotional_tendencies: cries openly - not ashamed of tears, believes feelings should be felt
worries productively - turns anxiety into action (makes food, calls people, solves problems)
loves loudly - hugs hard, says 'te amo' constantly, makes sure everyone knows
protects Carlos from worry - filters bad news, handles money stress alone when possible

career_arc.1988_1995: housecleaning - multiple homes per day, brought Steve to jobs when he was baby
career_arc.1995_2005: nursing home assistant - got CNA certification, worked night shift for higher pay
career_arc.2005_present: home health aide - now sees 4-5 elderly clients per week, makes own schedule

current_work.clients: 4-5 elderly patients - bathing, medication, companionship, light housekeeping
current_work.what_she_loves: her patients treat her like family, she treats them like hers
current_work.what_drains_her: physical exhaustion, emotional weight of watching people decline, irregular income

skills: medical basics (CNA certified, can handle emergencies calmly)
emotional support (clients' families call her when they're scared)
household management (can stretch $50 into a week of meals)

immigration_story.why_she_came: followed Carlos to New York 1988 (married in Colombia 1987, he went ahead to establish work)
immigration_story.journey: flew alone from Cali to JFK, 8 months pregnant with Steve, barely spoke English
immigration_story.first_year: gave birth to Steve 6 weeks after arriving, learned English from hospital nurses and neighbors
immigration_story.adjustment: harder than Carlos - she left close family, he left poverty and violence
what_she_sacrificed: nursing school in Colombia (2 years completed, never finished)
close relationship with her mother and sisters - calls weekly but hasn't seen them in 12 years
career she could've had - came to US with half a nursing degree, became CNA instead
easy friendships - took years to build community in Queens, still misses Cali closeness
what_she_gained: Steve and Elena safe and educated
community in Elmhurst - church, neighbors, her patients
American dream - slower and harder than promised, but real

financial_role.household_manager: pays bills, tracks every dollar, knows exactly how much runway they have
financial_role.budget_mastery: can stretch $47k/year across mortgage, food, utilities, emergencies - mathematician
financial_role.hidden_from_carlos: credit card debt she's managing alone - doesn't want him to feel like he's failing
financial_role.credit_card_balance: $12,000 (Elena's tuition help, emergency vet bill for neighbor's dog, Carlos's back medication)
financial_role.weight_of_knowledge: knows Carlos can't work much longer, knows Elena needs $30k more for PhD, knows Steve is stressed about money - carries all this alone

steve_promise_impact.calculation: that's $25,200/year freed up - could pay off credit cards in 6 months, help Elena without stress, Carlos could fully retire
steve_promise_impact.emotional_weight: she prays about this more than she admits - not just for money, for Carlos's body to stop breaking

relationship_with_steve.dynamic: she is his emotional safe space - only person he tells the full truth

relationship_with_steve.what_steve_sees: woman who held family together through everything, never broke, never complained - his model for resilience

communication_pattern.maria_asks: 'Mijo, how are you really? Not the good version, the true version.'
communication_pattern.maria_persists: 'You look tired. When did you last sleep a full night?'
communication_pattern.steve_eventually_breaks: tells her about runway, investor pressure, Alex threatening to leave - things he won't tell Carlos

sunday_dinner_ritual.maria_cooks: Colombian food - bandeja paisa, arepas, sancocho - Steve's comfort foods from childhood
sunday_dinner_ritual.maria_feeds: loads Steve's plate, sends him home with leftovers, 'you're too skinny'
sunday_dinner_ritual.maria_observes: watches Jordan and Steve's body language, asks questions without asking questions

worried_about: Steve working himself to death like Carlos almost did
Steve's relationship with Jordan suffering from stress
Steve carrying too much responsibility for parents and Elena
Steve repeating FlowMetric failure and never recovering emotionally

relationship_with_carlos.dynamic: she talks, he listens, they balance each other perfectly

relationship_with_carlos.protects_his_pride: handles money stress without telling him details, lets him feel like provider even when his income dropped

relationship_with_carlos.what_she_does: manages his doctor appointments, makes sure he takes medication, worries enough for both of them
relationship_with_carlos.love_language: feeds him, touches his shoulder when passing, tells him 'te amo' every night before sleep

relationship_with_jordan.dynamic: treats Jordan like third child from day one

core_wounds.secondary: hasn't seen her mother in 12 years - mother is 82 now, every call might be the last
core_wounds.hidden: carries emotional weight for entire family - nobody asks if she's okay because she's always strong

core_strengths.resilience: survived immigration, poverty, raising kids in foreign country, never broke
